links.title: Apple has a better credit rating than the USA | Philip Elmer‑DeWitt
links.description: U.S. treasuries got downgraded to AA+ in 2011. Apple's stock got upgraded today. From Reuters' " Moody's gives Apple top 'AAA' credit rating on growth promise " posted Tuesday: Ratings agency Moody's on Tuesday upgraded Apple Inc's long-term credit rating to 'AAA' with a stable outlook, citing the iPhone maker's "exceptional liquidity" and robust earnings.

$TSLA  These kids pumping Tesla to you have no idea what is in store for the market moving towards the first Federal interest rate hike next March. It will not be sunshine and rainbows and funny memes, a lot of traders are going to get squashed for being too green, not enough experience trading volatile markets, no idea how to or even what a hedge is, no idea how to properly utilize an account or use leverage. Pumps are all fun and games if you know how to play them, but you better believe they are going to get sold quickly as fuck as the market progresses into next year. Call holder who are up 1000% since Monday, I'd have taken profit today, because tesla will have at least a 50% retracement of its run from $890 on Tuesday. $SPY $AAPL $NASDAQ

links.title: Apple Closes Another 7 US, Canada Stores As COVID-19 Cases Among Employees Rise - Benzinga
links.description: Apple Inc AAPL has shuttered another seven retail stores in the United States and Canada due to increasing cases of COVID-19 among employees. What Happened: The list of temporary closures include locations in Dadeland, Florida; The Gardens Mall in Palm Beach, Florida; Lenox Square in Atlanta, Georgia, Highland Village in Houston, Texas; Summit Mall in Akron, Ohio; Pheasant Lane in Nashua, New Hampshire and Sainte-Catherine in Montreal, Quebec, according to an Apple Insider report.
